bioghist.p: The Map Collection of the Free Library of Philadelphia provides researchers and explorers with more than 130,000 current and historical maps, as well as other geographical resources, covering every part of the world. The collection is especially strong in Philadelphia and Pennsylvania maps and atlases, and an extensive collection of aerial photos of the Delaware Valley provides a fascinating view of the development of our region over the past 70 years.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of atlases of Philadelphia and vicinity. Materials include: Hexamer & Locher Maps of the City of Philadelphia, 1857, 7 vols; Hexamer and Son fire insurance maps, 1873-1920, vols. I-XXXV. (these comprise roughly half of the collection; multiple copies of many volumes); G.M. Hopkins &. Co. fire insurance maps, 7 vols. (1870s-1880s); Atlas of the city of Philadelphia. From actual surveys and official plans of the Survey Department, by Geo. W. & Walter S. Bromley. (1880s-1920s), 13 vols.; and Atlas of properties on Main Line Pennsylvania Railroad: from Overbrook to Paoli, from actual surveys and official plans / by George W. and Walter S. Bromley. G.W. Bromley & Co., 1926. The collection also includes atlases for the Pennsylvania Mainline and the Reading Mainline, Bucks, Chester, Delaware, Lancaster, and Montgomery counties, including volumes for towns and cities; atlases of the Franklin Survey Company (greater Northeast Philadelphia area); and a 1865 map of the Fair Hill Estate of Joseph Parker Norris.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
